title: Can an FLAC file have less than 1411 kbps and even less than 1000 kbps? Is it still considered as a FLAC? Does it still sound as good as the other FLAC files? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1411kbps in uncompressed bit rate: every second has 44100 samples * 16 bits, double that for stereo. FLAC is compressed and is around 900kbps. You get about a 30 per cent reduction in size. Since it’s lossless it will sound as well as the original. FLAC with 1411kbps is really not quite FLAC at all, but rather an uncompressed wave file.
